abstract.text: A color represented in RGBA format.

inlineContent.text: A color represented in RGBA format by a red (
) component. Each component is a 32-bit floating-point value, usually ranging from
, for overbright or HDR (High Dynamic Range) colors.
Colors can be created in various ways: By the various
constructors, by static methods such as

A color represented in RGBA format.
Types that conform to VariantStorable can be stored in a Variant and can be extracted
either from an HTML color code or from a standardized color name, with
on the range of 0.0 to 1.0. The supported color names are the same as the constants.
Returns the color converted to a 32-bit integer in ABGR format (each component is 8 bits). ABGR is the reversed version of the default RGBA format.
The color’s blue component, typically on the range of 0 to 1.
Abstract base class for everything in 2D space.
A special OpenGL texture format where the three color components have 9 bits of precision and all three share a single 5-bit exponent.

Returns a new color resulting from overlaying this color over the given color. In a painting program, you can imagine it as the
color painted over this color (including alpha).
Structs and scalar types use their own layout for storage.

Returns the light intensity of the color, as a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive). This is useful when determining light or dark color. Colors with a luminance smaller than 0.5 can be generally considered dark.
from RGB values, typically between 0.0 and 1.0.

Inverts the given color. This is equivalent to Color.WHITE - c or Color(1 - c.r, 1 - c.g, 1 - c.b, 1 - c.a). Unlike with inverted, the a component is inverted, too.
